parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name/>=<value> Game

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.68</value></part><part><name>Game Version (number surrounded by NO SPACES)</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Enable/disable object as a feature/landmark. Possible feature types:
* 0 - Feature disabled
* 1 - Object is always visible within object view distance
* 2 - Object is always visible within terrain view distance
The limit is 500 map/static objects and 200 dynamic objects including config features and auto features (flying helicopters, airplanes). When limit is reached, function returns false.</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object [[setFeatureType]] type </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> type: [[Number]] - the desired feature type </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> Set a building to be always rendered:
<code> building [[setFeatureType]] 2;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[setViewDistance]], [[setObjectViewDistance]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on October 10, 2017 - 16:18 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Waffle SS.|Waffle SS.]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
For world objects, command effect persists '''after mission restart'''. Map must be reloaded to automatically revert setting.
</dd>
